info.name: picasso.js
info.description: A charting library streamlined for building visualizations for the Qlik Sense Analytics platform.

examples:
import picasso from 'picasso.js';

const configuredPicasso = picasso({ renderer: { prio: ['canvas'] } }) // All components will render using the canvas renderer

const svgFactory = picassojs.renderer('svg');
const svgRenderer = svgFactory();

addAndRemoveValues.description:
Add and remove values in a single operation
almost the same as calling addValues and removeValues but only triggers one 'update' event

If the state of the brush changes, an 'update' event is emitted.

addKeyAlias.description: Adds an alias to the given key
examples:
brush.addKeyAlias('BadFieldName', 'Region');
brush.addValue('BadFieldName', 'Sweden'); // 'BadFieldName' will be stored as 'Region'
brush.containsValue('Region', 'Sweden'); // true
brush.containsValue('BadFieldName', 'Sweden'); // true

addRange.description: Adds a numeric range to this brush context

params.name: key
params.description: An identifier that represents the data source of the range

params.name: range
params.description: The range to add to this brush

examples: brush.addRange('Sales', { min: 20, max: 50 });

params.name: items
params.description: Items containing the ranges to remove

addValue.description:
Adds a primitive value to this brush context

If this brush context is not started, a 'start' event is emitted.
If the state of the brush changes, ie. if the added value does not already exist, an 'update' event is emitted.

params.name: key
params.description: An identifier that represents the data source of the value

examples:
brush.addValue('countries', 'Sweden');
brush.addValue('/qHyperCube/qDimensionInfo/0', 3);

brushes.description: Returns all brushes within this context

containsRange.description:
Checks if a range segment is contained within this brush context

Returns true if the range segment exists for the provided key, returns false otherwise.

params.name: key
params.description: An identifier that represents the data source of the value

examples:
brush.addRange('Sales', { min: 10, max: 50 });
brush.containsRange('Sales', { min: 15, max: 20 }); // true - the range segment is fully contained within [10, 50]
brush.containsRange('Sales', { min: 5, max: 20 }); // false - part of the range segment is outside [10, 50]
brush.containsRange('Sales', { min: 30, max: 80 }); // false - part of the range segment is outside [10, 50]

containsRangeValue.description:
Checks if a value is contained within a range in this brush context

Returns true if the values exists for the provided key, returns false otherwise.

params.name: key
params.description: An identifier that represents the data source of the value

containsValue.description:
Checks if a certain value exists in this brush context

Returns true if the values exists for the provided key, returns false otherwise.

params.name: key
params.description: An identifier that represents the data source of the value

examples:
brush.addValue('countries', 'Sweden');
brush.containsValue('countries', 'Sweden'); // true
brush.toggleValue('countries', 'Sweden'); // remove 'Sweden'
brush.containsValue('countries', 'Sweden'); // false

end.description:
Ends this brush context

Ends this brush context and emits an 'end' event if it is not already ended.

params.name: args
params.description: arguments to be passed to 'end' listeners

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the event to intercept

params.name: ic
params.description: Handler to call before event is triggered

isActive.description:
Checks if this brush is activated

Returns true if started, false otherwise

link.description:
Link this brush to another brush instance.

When linked, the `target` will receive updates whenever this brush changes.

params.name: target
params.description: The brush instance to link to

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the event to remove interceptors for. If not provided, removes all interceptors.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the event to intercept

removeKeyAlias.description:
Removes an alias

This will only remove the key to alias mapping for new manipulations of the brush,
no changes will be made to the current state of this brush.
examples: brush.removeKeyAlias('BadFieldName');

removeRange.description: Removes a numeric range from this brush context

params.name: key
params.description: An identifier that represents the data source of the range

params.name: range
params.description: The range to remove from this brush

params.name: items
params.description: Items containing the ranges to remove

removeValue.description:
Removes a primitive values from this brush context

If the state of the brush changes, ie. if the removed value does exist, an 'update' event is emitted.

params.name: key
params.description: An identifier that represents the data source of the value

examples: brush.removeValue('countries', 'Sweden');

setRange.description:
Sets a numeric range to this brush context

Overwrites any active ranges identified by `key`

params.name: key
params.description: An identifier that represents the data source of the range

params.name: range
params.description: The range to set on this brush

params.name: items
params.description: Items containing the ranges to set

start.description:
Starts this brush context

Starts this brush context and emits a 'start' event if it is not already started.

params.name: args
params.description: arguments to be passed to 'start' listeners

toggleRange.description:
Toggles a numeric range in this brush context

Removes the range if it's already contained within the given identifier,
otherwise the given range is added to the brush.

params.name: key
params.description: An identifier that represents the data source of the range

params.name: range
params.description: The range to toggle in this brush

params.name: items
params.description: Items containing the ranges to toggle

toggleValue.description:
Toggles a primitive value in this brush context

If the given value exists in this brush context, it will be removed. If it does not exist it will be added.

params.name: key
params.description: An identifier that represents the data source of the value

examples: brush.toggleValue('countries', 'Sweden');

end.description: Triggered when this brush is deactivated

start.description: Triggered when this brush is activated

update.description: Triggered when this brush is updated

includeMax.description: Whether or not the maximum value of a range should be included when determining if a value is brushed.

includeMin.description: Whether or not the minimum value of a range should be included when determining if a value is brushed.

key.description: An identifier that represents the data source of the value

context.description: Name of the brush context to observe

data.description: The mapped data properties to observe

mode.description: Data properties operator: and, or, xor.

style.description: The style to apply to the shapes of the component

active.description: The style of active data points

inactive.description: The style of inactive data points

contexts.description: Name of the brushing contexts to affect

data.description: The mapped data properties to add to the brush

action.description: Type of action to respond with

on.description: Type of interaction to trigger brush on

action.description: Type of interaction to respond with

contexts.description: Name of the brushing contexts to affect

data.description: The mapped data properties to add to the brush

propagation.description: Control the event propagation when multiple shapes are tapped. Disabled by default

globalPropagation.description: Control the event propagation between components. Disabled by default

touchRadius.description: Extend contact area for touch events. Disabled by default

mouseRadius.description: Extend contact area for regular mouse events. Disabled by default

examples:
{
   on: 'tap',
   action: 'toggle',
   contexts: ['selection', 'tooltip'],
   data: ['x'],
   propagation: 'stop', // 'stop' => prevent trigger from propagating further than the first shape
   globalPropagation: 'stop', // 'stop' => prevent trigger of same type to be triggered on other components
   touchRadius: 24,
   mouseRadius: 10
 }

brush.description: Get or create brush context for this chart

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the brush context. If no match is found, a new brush context is created and returned.

brushFromShapes.description: Brush data by providing a collection of data bound shapes.

params.name: shapes
params.description: An array of data bound shapes.

components.description: Array of components to include in the lookup

params.name: p
params.description: Point with x- and y-coordinate. The coordinate is relative to the browser viewport.

findShapes.description: Get all nodes matching the provided selector

returns.description: Array of objects containing matching nodes

examples:
chart.findShapes('Circle') // [<CircleNode>, <CircleNode>]
chart.findShapes('Circle[fill="red"][stroke!="black"]') // [CircleNode, CircleNode]
chart.findShapes('Container Rect') // [Rect, Rect]

formatter.description: Get or create a formatter for this chart
examples:
instance.formatter('nameOfMyFormatter'); // Fetch an existing formatter by name
instance.formatter({ formatter: 'nameOfMyFormatter' }); // Fetch an existing formatter by name
instance.formatter({ type: 'q' }); // Fetch an existing formatter by type
instance.formatter({
 formatter: 'd3',
 type: 'number',
 format: '1.0.%'
}); // Create a new formatter

getAffectedShapes.description: Get all shapes associated with the provided context

params.name: props
params.description: Which specific data properties to compare

params.name: key
params.description: Which component to get shapes from. Default gives shapes from all components.

returns.description: Array of objects containing shape and parent element

examples:
chart.interactions.instances; // Array of all interaction instances
chart.interactions.on(); // Toggle on all interactions instances
chart.interactions.off(); // Toggle off all interactions instances

layoutComponents.description: Layout the chart with new settings and / or data

excludeFromUpdate.description: Keys of components to not include in the layout

scale.description: Get or create a scale for this chart
examples:
instance.scale('nameOfMyScale'); // Fetch an existing scale by name
instance.scale({ scale: 'nameOfMyScale' }); // Fetch an existing scale by name
instance.scale({ source: '0/1', type: 'linear' }); // Create a new scale

shapesAt.description:
Get all nodes colliding with a geometrical shape (circle, line, rectangle, point, polygon, geopolygon).

The input shape is identified based on the geometrical attributes in the following order: circle => line => rectangle => point => polygon => geopolygon.
Note that not all nodes on a scene have collision detection enabled.

params.name: shape
params.description: A geometrical shape. Coordinates are relative to the top-left corner of the chart instance container.

components.description: Array of components to include in the lookup. If no components are specified, all components will be included.

propagation.description: if set to `stop`, will start lookup on top visible shape and propagate downwards until a shape is found.
if set to `stop`, will start lookup on top visible component and propagate downwards until a component has at least a match.

returns.description: Array of objects containing colliding nodes

params.name: val
params.description: Toggle brushing on or off. If value is omitted, a toggle action is applied to the current state.

update.description: Update the chart with new settings and / or data

partialData.description: If set to true, will trigger a data update only. Meaning the layout will not be updated

excludeFromUpdate.description: Keys of components to not include in the update

beforeDestroy.description: Called before the chart has been destroyed

beforeMount.description: Called before the chart has been mounted

beforeRender.description: Called before the chart has been rendered

beforeUpdate.description: Called before the chart has been updated

created.description: Called when the chart has been created

destroyed.description: Called after the chart has been destroyed

mounted.description: Called after the chart has been mounted

params.name: element
params.description: The element the chart been mounted to

updated.description: Called after the chart has been updated

scale.description: reference to band or linear scale

align.description: Set the anchoring point of the axis. Available options are `auto/left/right/bottom/top`. In `auto` the axis determines the best option. The options are restricted based on the axis orientation, a vertical axis may only anchor on `left` or `right`
Align act as a slider for the text bounding rect over the item bandwidth, given that the item have a bandwidth.

filterOverlapping.description:
Toggle whether labels should be filtered if they are overlapping. Filtering may be applied in a non-sequential order.
If labels are overlapping and this setting is toggled off, the axis will automatically hide.

margin.description: Space in pixels between the tick and label.

maxLengthPx.description: Max length of labels in pixels

minLengthPx.description: Min length of labels in pixels. Labels will always at least require this much space

offset.description: Offset in pixels along the axis direction.

margin.description: Space in pixels between the ticks and the line.

tickSize.description: Size of the ticks in pixels.

paddingEnd.description: Padding in direction perpendicular to the axis

paddingStart.description: Padding in direction perpendicular to the axis

margin.description: Space in pixels between the ticks and the line.

tickSize.description: Size of the ticks in pixels.

align.description: Set the anchoring point of the axis. Available options are `auto/left/right/bottom/top`. In `auto` the axis determines the best option. The options are restricted based on the axis orientation, a vertical axis may only anchor on `left` or `right`

Align act as a slider for the text bounding rect over the item bandwidth, given that the item have a bandwidth. Except when labels are tilted, then the align is a pure align that shifts the position of the label anchoring point.

filterOverlapping.description:
Toggle whether labels should be filtered if they are overlapping. Filtering may be applied in a non-sequential order.
If labels are overlapping and this setting is toggled off, the axis will automatically hide.

margin.description: Space in pixels between the tick and label.

maxEdgeBleed.description: Control the amount of space (in pixels) that labes can occupy outside their docking area. Only applicable when labels are in `tilted` mode.

maxGlyphCount.description: When only a sub-set of data is available, ex. when paging. This property can be used to let the axis estimate how much space the labels will consume, allowing it to give a consistent space estimate over the entire dataset when paging.

maxLengthPx.description: Max length of labels in pixels

minLengthPx.description: Min length of labels in pixels. Labels will always at least require this much space

mode.description: Control how labels arrange themself. Availabe modes are `auto`, `horizontal`, `layered` and `tilted`. When set to `auto` the axis determines the best possible layout in the current context.

offset.description: Offset in pixels along the axis direction.

tiltAngle.description: Tilting angle in degrees. Capped between -90 and 90. Only applicable when labels are in `tilted` mode.

tiltThreshold.description: Threshold for toggle of tilted labels. Capped between 0 and 1. For example, if it is set to 0.7, then tilted labels will be toggled if less than 70% of the labels are visible.

paddingEnd.description: Padding in direction perpendicular to the axis

paddingStart.description: Padding in direction perpendicular to the axis

margin.description: Space in pixels between the ticks and the line.

tickSize.description: Size of the ticks in pixels.

scale.description: The scale to use along the major (dimension) axis

ref.description: Reference to the data property along the major axis

scale.description: The scale to use along the minor (measure) axis

orientation.description: Which orientation to use (vertical or horizontal)

box.description: Visual properties for the box shape in the box marker

show.description: Boolean for showing the box shape

maxWidthPx.description: Maximum width of the box in pixels (not applicable when using major start and end)

minWidthPx.description: Minimum width of the box in pixels (not applicable when using major start and end)

minHeightPx.description: Minimum height of the box shape

line.description: Visual properties for lines between min-start, end-max.

whisker.description: All the visual properties for whiskers at min and max.

oob.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Out of bounds symbol utilizing the symbol API

type.description: Type of the symbol to be used

size.description: Size/width of the symbol in pixels

sides.description: Number of sides for a n-polygon (3 for triangle)

start.description: Reference to the data property of the start value along the major axis

end.description: Reference to the data property of the end value along the major axis

ComponentBrushArea.description: A component that can brush a rectangular area

show.description: True to show label bubble, false otherwise

components.description: Render matching overlay on target components

threshold.description: The distance in pixel to show the snap indicator, if less then threshold the indicator is dispalyed

components.description: Array of components to brush on.

contexts.description: Name of the brushing contexts to affect

data.description: The mapped data properties to add to the brush

action.description: Type of action to respond with

brush.description: Brush context to apply changes to

show.description: True to show label bubble, false otherwise

components.description: Render matching overlay on target components

selector.description: Instead of targeting a component, target one or more shapes

fillSelector.description: Target a subset of the selector as fill area. Only applicable if `selector` property is set

scale.description: The scale to use along x
The scale to use along y

direction.description: The direction in which the bars are growing: 'up', 'down', 'right' or 'left'.

justify.description: Placement of the label along the direction of the bar

align.description: Placement of the label along the perpendicular direction of the bar

overflow.description: True if the label is allowed to overflow the bar

padding.description: Padding between the label and the bar

top.description: Padding-top between the label and the bar

bottom.description: Padding-bottom between the label and the bar

left.description: Padding-left between the label and the bar

right.description: Padding-right between the label and the bar

padding.description: Padding between the label and the background

top.description: Padding-top between the label and the background

bottom.description: Padding-bottom between the label and the background

left.description: Padding-left between the label and the background

right.description: Padding-right between the label and the background

direction.description: The direction of the text: 'horizontal' or 'rotate'.

lineHeight.description: Line height as a multiple of the font size

maxLines.description: Max number of lines allowed if label is broken into multiple lines (only applicable with wordBreak)

maxWidth.description: Maximum width of label, in px

wordBreak.description: Word break rule, how to apply line break if label text overflows its maxWidth property. Either `'break-word'` or `'break-all'`

show.description: Whether to show the current item

size.description: Maximum number of columns (vertical) or rows (horizontal)

disabled.description: Whether the button should be disabled or not

anchor.description: Horizontal alignment of the text. Allowed values are `'start'`, `'middle'` and `'end'`

lineHeight.description: Line height as a multiple of the font size

maxLines.description: Max number of lines allowed if label is broken into multiple lines, is only appled when `wordBreak` is not set to `'none'`

maxWidth.description: Maximum width of title, in px

text.description: Title text. Defaults to the title of the provided data field

wordBreak.description: Word break rule, how to apply line break if label text overflows its maxWidth property. Either `'break-word'` or `'break-all'`

fill.description: Reference to definition of sequential color scale

major.description: Reference to definition of linear scale

size.description: Size in pixels of the legend, if vertical is the width and height otherwise

length.description: A value in the range 0-1 indicating the length of the legend node

align.description: A value in the range 0-1 indicating horizontal alignment of the legend's content. 0 aligns to the left, 1 to the right.

justify.description: A value in the range 0-1 indicating vertical alignment of the legend's content. 0 aligns to the top, 1 to the bottom.

label.description: Function applied to all tick values. Return value should be a string and is used as label

anchor.description: Where to anchor the tick in relation to the legend node, supported values are [top, bottom, left and right] or empty string to auto anchor

padding.description: padding in pixels to the legend node

text.description: Title text. Defaults to the title of the provided data field

padding.description: padding in pixels to the legend node

anchor.description: Where to anchor the title in relation to the legend node, supported values are [top, left and right] or empty string to auto anchor

wordBreak.description: How overflowing title is handled, if it should insert line breaks at word boundries (break-word) or character boundries (break-all)

hyphens.description: How words should be hyphenated when text wraps across multiple lines (only applicable with wordBreak)

maxLines.description: Number of allowed lines if title contains line breaks (only applicable with wordBreak)

lineHeight.description: A multiplier defining the distance between lines (only applicable with wordBreak)

endAngle.description: End angle of the pie, in radians

arc.description: Absolute value of the slice's arc length

cornerRadius.description: Corner radius of the slice, in pixels

startAngle.description: Start angle of the pie, in radians

show.description: Whether or not to show the point

maxPx.description: Maximum size of shape, in pixels

maxRelDiscrete.description: Maximum size relative discrete scale banwidth

maxRelExtent.description: Maximum size relative linear scale extent

minPx.description: Minimum size of shape, in pixels

minRelDiscrete.description: Minimum size relative discrete scale banwidth

minRelExtent.description: Minimum size relative linear scale extent

value.description: The value of the reference line. If a scale is specified, it is applied.

scale.description: Scale to use (if undefined will use normalized value 0-1)

label.description: The label style of the line

align.description: Alignment property left to right (0 = left, 1 = right). Also supports string ('left', 'center', 'middle', 'right')

vAlign.description: Alignment property top to bottom (0 = top, 1 = bottom). Also supports string ('top', 'center', 'middle', 'bottom')

maxWidth.description: The maximum relative width to the width of the rendering area (see maxWidthPx as well)

maxWidthPx.description: The maximum width in pixels. Labels will be rendered with the maximum size of the smallest value of maxWidth and maxWidthPx size, so you may specify maxWidth 0.8 but maxWidthPx 100 and will never be over 100px and never over 80% of the renderable area

ComponentSettings.description: Generic settings available to all components

created.description: Called when the component has been created

beforeMount.description: Called before the component has been mounted

mounted.description: Called after the component has been mounted

beforeUpdate.description: Called before the component has been updated

updated.description: Called after the component has been updated

beforeRender.description: Called before the component has been rendered

beforeDestroy.description: Called before the component has been destroyed

destroyed.description: Called after the component has been destroyed

sortNodes.description: Sorting function for nodes. Should return sorted nodes.

minimumLayoutMode.description: Refer to layout sizes defined by layoutModes in `strategy`

show.description: If the component should be rendered

scale.description: Named scale. Will be provided to the component if it asks for it.

formatter.description: Named formatter. Fallback to create formatter from scale. Will be provided to the component if it asks for it.

strategy.description: Layout strategy used for child components.

data.description: Extracted data that should be available to the component

rendererSettings.description: Settings for the renderer used to render the component

anchor.description: Where to v- or h-align the text. Supports `left`, `right`, `top`, `bottom` and `center`

join.description: String to add when joining titles from multiple sources

afterHide.description: Component lifecycle hook. Called after the tooltip is hidden.

afterShow.description: Component lifecycle hook. Called after the tooltip have been displayed.

appendTo.description: Explicitly set a target element. This allows the tooltip to attach itself outside the picasso container.

beforeHide.description: Component lifecycle hook. Called before the tooltip is hidden.

element.description: The element the tooltip is appended to

beforeShow.description: Component lifecycle hook. Called before the tooltip is displayed.

content.description: Callback function to generate content. Should return an array of Virtual DOM Elements.

data.description: An array of data generated from the `extract` function

h.description: A function for creating Virtual DOM Elements. See API reference for preactjs `h` function

returns.description: An array of Virtual DOM Elements

examples: ({ h, data }) => data.map((datum) => h('div', {}, datum))

delay.description: Delay before the tooltip is rendered, in milliseconds

duration.description: How long the tooltip is visible, in milliseconds

extract.description: Callback function called for each node to extract data. Can return any type.
examples: (ctx) => ctx.node.data.value

filter.description:
Callback function to filter incoming nodes to only a set of applicable nodes. Is called as a part of the `show` event.

Should return an array of SceneNodes.
examples: filter: (nodes) => nodes.filter((node) => node.data && typeof node.data.value !== 'undefined')

isEqual.description:
Comparison function. If evaluted to true, the incoming nodes in the `show` event are ignored. If evaluated to false, any active tooltip is cleared and a new tooltip is queued.

The function gets two parameters, the first is the currently active set of nodes, if any, and the second is the incoming set of nodes. By default the two set of nodes are considered equal if their data attributes are the same.

onHide.description: Component lifecycle hook. Called when the toolip is hidden. By default this deletes the tooltip element.

element.description: The element the tooltip is appended to

area.description:
Specify the limiting area, where target is the component area unless the appendTo property is set, in which case it referes to the appendTo element. Viewport is the browser viewport.

Available options are: [viewport | target]

dock.description: Docking position of the tooltip. Available positions: [left | right | top | bottom | auto]

offset.description: Distance from the content area to the tooltip position, in px.

DataExtraction.description: Used to extract data from a `DataSource`

stack.description: If provided, defines how the data should be stacked

stackKey.description: Callback function. Should return the key to stack by

value.description: Callback function. Should return the data value to stack with

filter.description: Callback function to filter the extracted data items

sort.description: Callback function to sort the extracted data items

Extract.description: Data extraction definition. Define how and what kind of data should be extracted from a `DataSource`.

source.description: Which data source to extract from

field.description: The field to extract data from

props.description: Additional properties to add to the extracted item

field.description: The field to extract data from

FilterCallback.description: Callback function to filter the extracted data items

returns.description: Return true if the datum should be included in the final data set

SortCallback.description: Callback function to sort the extracted data items

returns.description: If less than 0, sort a before b. If greater than 0, sort b before a

StackKeyCallback.description: Callback function. Should return the key to stack by

returns.description: The data value to stack by

StackValueCallback.description: Callback function. Should return the data value to stack with

returns.description: The data value to stack with

source.description: Which data source to extract from

field.description: The field to extract data from

extract.description: Extract data items from this dataset

field.description: Find a field within this dataset

fields.description: Get all fields within this dataset

key.description: Get the key identifying this dataset
Unique identifier for this data source

examples: (d) => Math.min(0, d.value);

DatumBoolean.description: Custom type that is either a boolean, DatumConfig or a datumAccessor

ref.description: A reference to a DatumExtract property

label.description: The extracted value as a string

source.description: The data source of the extracted data

DatumNumber.description: Custom type that is either a number, DatumConfig or a datumAccessor

DatumString.description: Custom type that is either a string, DatumConfig or a datumAccessor

preserveAspectRatio.description: If true, takes the smallest ratio of width/height between logical and physical size ( physical / logical )

align.description: Normalized value between 0-1. Defines how the space around the scaled axis is spread in the container, with 0.5 meaning the spread is equal on both sides. Only applicable if preserveAspectRatio is set to true

center.description: Define how much space the center dock area requires

size.description: Size is equal to that of the container (element) of the chart by default. It's possible to overwrite it by explicitly setting width or height

formatter.description: Returns a formatter adapted to the content of this field.

items.description: Returns the values of this field.

max.description: Returns the max value of this field.

min.description: Returns the min value of this field.

data.description: The data to create formatter from

enable.description: Enable or disable the interaction handler. If a callback function is provided, it must return either true or false

plugin.description: Callback function to register a plugin

ProgressiveObject.description: A format to represent a data chunk to be rendered.

start.description: Start index of a data chunk.

end.description: End index of a data chunk.

isFirst.description: If it is the first data chunk rendered. This helps to clear a canvas before rendering.

isLast.description: If it is the last data chunk rendered. This helps to update other components depending on a component with progressive rendering.

registry.description: Register a `value` with the given `key`. If `value` is omitted, returns the `value` of `key`.

params.name: key
params.description: Name of the type to register

params.name: value
params.description: Value to store in the registry.

clear.description: Clear all child elements from the renderer root element

destory.description: Remove the renderer root element from its parent element

element.description: Get the element this renderer is attached to

findShapes.description: Get all nodes matching the provided selector

returns.description: Array of objects containing matching nodes

params.name: geometry
params.description: Get nodes that intersects with geometry

returns.description: True if the nodes were rendered, otherwise false

root.description: Get the root element of the renderer

size.description: Set or Get the size definition of the renderer container.

transform.description: Setting for applying transform without re-rendering the whole component completely.

canvasBufferSize.description: Specifies the size of buffer canvas (used together with transform setting).

progressive.description: Setting for applying progressive rendering to a canvas renderer

CanvasBufferSize.description:
An object containing width and height of the canvas buffer or a function returning an object on that format.
Gets a rect object as input parameter.

Progressive.description:
A function which returns either (1) false (to specify no progressive rendering used) or an object specifing the data chunk rendered.
 This is only applied to a canvas renderer.

TransformFunction.description:
Should return a transform object if transformation should be applied, otherwise undefined or a falsy value.
Transforms can be applied with the canvas, svg and dom renderer.
Transform is applied when running chart.update, see example.
!Important: When a transform is applied to a component, the underlaying node representations are not updated with the new positions/sizes, which
can cause problems for operations that relies on the positioning of the shapes/nodes (such as tooltips, selections etc). An extra chart update
without a transform is therefore needed to make sure the node position information is in sync with the visual representation again.

padding.description: Sets both inner and outer padding to the same value

align.description: Control how the outer padding should be distributed, where 0.5 would distribute the padding equally on both sides

maxPxStep.description: Explicitly limit the bandwidth to a pixel value

label.description: Callback label function, applied on each datum

value.description: Callback value function, applied on each datum

range.description: Set range explicitly (ignored when maxPxStep takes effect)
CSS color values of the output range

unknown.description: Value to return when input value is unknown

explicit.description: Explicitly bind values to an output

ScaleDefinition.description: Definition for creating a scale. Additional properties, specific for a type of scale, can be added as key/value pairs

include.description: Include specified numbers in the output range

values.description: If set, ticks are no longer generated but instead equal to this set

range.description: CSS color values of the output range
CSS color values of the output range

nice.description: If set to true, will generate 'nice' domain values. Ignored if domain is set.

SceneNode.description: Read-only object representing a node on the scene.

bounds.description:
Bounding rectangle of the node. After any transform has been applied, if any, but excluding scaling transform related to devicePixelRatio.
Origin is in the top-left corner of the scene element.

boundsRelativeTo.description:
Bounding rectangle of the node, relative a target.

If target is an HTMLElement, the bounds are relative to the HTMLElement.
Any other target type will return the bounds relative to the viewport of the browser.

params.name: includeTransform
params.description: Whether to include any applied transforms on the node

examples:
node.boundsRelativeTo($('div'));
node.boundsRelativeTo('viewport');

collider.description:
Collider of the node. Transform on the node has been applied to the collider shape, if any, but excluding scaling transform related to devicePixelRatio.
Origin is in the top-left corner of the scene element.

If node has no collider, null is returned.

element.description: Element the scene is attached to

key.description: Key of the component this shape belongs to

localBounds.description:
Bounding rectangle of the node within its local coordinate system.
Origin is in the top-left corner of the scene element.

TransformObject.description: A format to represent a transformation.
